title: Account lost with thousands in cash wasted

embed.description: Post with 1 votes and 1 views. Shared by wristviolinplayer. riot games policy

body:
This 4 lines of text I jokingly typed in a **TFT game**

as riotgames proclaims:
PUNISHMENTS GENERALLY FOLLOW A BASIC ESCALATION PATH:

First Offense: 10 Game Chat Restriction
Second Offense: 25 Game Chat Restriction
Third Offense: Two Week Suspension
Fourth Offense: Permanent Suspension

However, it is possible to skip to a Two Week or Permanent suspension based on the severity of the behavior in the game. Excessive negative behavior can result in a Two-Week or Permanent suspension at any time without having a chat restriction on the account.

my previous offence was a year ago and I was never once given a chat restrict, or warning prior to even the first one, or ever. and player support easily bypasses this by judging the "severity' themselves. I wish i could post that past chatlog. since most of the typing that game was in teamchat with a 5-man queue anyway.

https://imgur.com/gallery/BIAXTEg
this was what i sent, expecting a quick resolution
what they actually replied with is this:

https://imgur.com/gallery/1XG7wu8

1 abbreviation for a 1500$ account?

this kind of practice is extremely shady.
there are people terrorizing ranked queues and they deem this to be the priority to permaban from the game.

since they have "recorded evidence" of toxicity.
while people disguise their int feeding as "bad games" and I can't even say something in a TFT game.

I have never inted a single game nor have I ever prevented my team from winning as long as there was a chance. no matter how angry this game gets me. but this?

this is a complete travesty. if this is how riot games deals with toxicity then all players should know what to think.
I would threaten legal action,
but their definitions on personal attacks are so murky that this and go-to excuse for ignoring cases like these make it so that the possibility of me recovering anything is nothing but a happy dream. all this just because I used a no-no abbreviation. In a game famous for having players intentionally throw games with no repercussions and are now embraced into a content creator program.

I want anyone willing to listen in this community to do me a favor

to spread this post for all to see how absurd this system is and to push for change.

replies.body:
Two main things: 

1) Money spent shouldn't make a difference on your punishment. It shouldn't be a shield for you to hide behind or for you to use to try and get away with more.

2) You used a Zero-Tolerance phrase. Im hoping the term defines itself enough for you to realize what it means. While you may claim to have said it jokingly, you are talking through text, in an online environment. Sarcasm and jokes usually don't come across well and even if they did, that particular term isn't one you throw out as a joke. Ever. 


You were clearly warning on your 14-day suspension that any further negative behavior would be met with a permanent ban. Using a zero-tolerance phrase is definitely considered negative behavior and using it may have been what escalated your first punishment into a 14-day suspension immediately instead of the regular gradual progressions that happen with less egregious violations of the Summoners Code and ToS.

Should anyone ask, I would be happy to refer them to this post so they  can see the system is working as intended and to push for a change to make this happen more often.

The irony of this intolerance. Yes, let's glorify the unabashed punishment of irritated people. Let's wave the ToS like a holy symbol to smite the evildoers. I would point to this as an example of SJW behavior.

Now I'm not trying to annoy you, but pushing a point that I'm going to keep pushing in hopes that some of you wake up.

Right... except instead of a holy symbol it's literally something you agreed to in order to play the game... and then proceeded to violate it. It's not something that I believe in that I think you should too. It's something you agreed to. If you thought it was so unreasonable, don't agree to the terms.

You are pushing a point that you broke the rules you agreed to and now want them changed retroactively to support your negative behavior. At the end of the day, you used zero-tolerance language after receiving a suspension and a ban previously.

Sir, I did no such things! I am but a fellow bystander commenting on justice.

My stance is that the punishment is too severe, understanding that this is how the system is currently set up. In other words, I understand that this is the punishment called for according to the ToS and that he is guilty. The OP states the same. I say it should not be so harsh a punishment.

My bad. I assumed it was the OP responding. 

In that case I refer you to Zero-Tolerance. It means well... Zero tolerance. He already received a suspension and told that he would be permanently banned for any further infraction. Not only was he negative, he used a phrase that the system punishes even harsher than most other forms of toxicity. There is no place in the game, or life, for that phrase, among a couple others. While I am not sure if I would support an instant permanent ban or lengthier initial ban for the use of that phrase, using it after a previous suspension and a warning is despicable and should definitely result in a permanent ban. 

If the OP feels like they are able to refrain from blatant toxicity moving forward he is welcome to make a new account and go from there.

In my experience, zero-tolerance policies are harmful and should be reserved for the most extreme things. "KYS" may seem extreme, but that's from a (what should be banned in regards to chat?) point of view. Persistent verbal abuse from one person to another individual should be zero-tolerance, not an off-handed "kys".

Forget for a moment that we're talking about League. An off-handed use of "kill yourself" is equivalent in severity of meaning as "go F yourself". It is obvious that the speaker does not intend to persuade the person to go masturbate, nor kill themselves. Instances where people are considered for manslaughter with "kill yourself" are in persistent, honest abuse with clear intent to persuade the person to actually kill themselves. It would be the same with "F yourself"- only if the person were actually being abusive in an attempt to have them masturbate.

Back to League and Zero Tolerance. In what way do off-handed comments actually threaten the profit of Riot? In this case, the ban clearly is going to cost Riot more. It has been a year since this individual received any punishment and is getting perma-banned from a black-and-white ZERO TOLERANCE rule. That means it is Riot's stance that this ONE INSTANCE ...

ONE.

INSTANCE.

That's what Zero Tolerance means.

...is going to cost them more to let it slide than to punish it with a permanent ban.

Sorry. That is wrong.

Mate, you are really destroying your own platform you standing on.... You said it best "In this case, the ban clearly is going to cost Riot more." Yea.. you right it will, and they doing it, not for themselves, but for the community, to try and keep these hateful, negative people out. Riots biggest issue, some may say bugs... Which can be true... But is the players, they gave him chances, as i responded to you before. Riot clearly did not want to flat out perma ban him, but they had to, he used up all is chances and never learned. Riot is not some evil mastermind, they are people following there own rules set by the company, and honestly these rules are not that hard to follow, they basic thing people should not do.
Your words have swayed me to his guilt. I did not consider how much authority Riot gave to it's player behavior folks. I believe they're not wise in this, as Zero Tolerance is not a good policy.
Yea it's not good for people who can't stop themselves from using slurs left and right.
yea u should be permad for typing that word, the system is working as intended

The intent is madness. In the face-to-face world, it takes a heck of a lot more than _a little chat_ to get permabanned.

0.006%, my ass. This number must have been derived from All the accounts ever made with League. What gets me livid about this willy-nilly system of permabanning is it's inconsistency, and the sort of behavior that is a result of the examples.
So you think it's okay to tell someone else to kill themselves?

No, but I think the punishment is bogus. Personally, I see this "kys" as a terrible reason for us as a community to spit on this person and say

"Don't come back, you're a terrible person for this community."

Talk about entitled. This isn't some pristine field of calm tranquility, it's a _game about killing_.

So you think telling someone to end their life over a video game should be permissible?

If you don't think the community should dislike it and report it, then you are saying it should be tolerated, which is the same as saying it's permissible. There is no "middle ground". Either it's okay, or it's not. If it's not, it should be punished heavily because **it's literally telling someone to end their life**.

Maybe you don't keep up with news, but **people go to jail for this sort of thing in real life**. Literally, people have been sent to jail in multiple countries for encouraging other people to commit suicide. It's not okay. Period.

There is a [massive difference between people being considered for jail for encouraging suicide](https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/wd7gx5/is-telling-someone-to-commit-suicide-a-crime-902) and this case. This is presently a black-and-white issue, which I see as tragic, because just typing "kill yourself" with hardly anything aggravating beyond it is insubstantial. Nobody with such fragility of mind that could actually be somewhat moved by this player's 4 lines should be playing League in the first place.

You're treating his words as though they were a wielded sword. They're nothing though. They carry no weight. That is to say, his words were empty. At best, they convey that he was irritated. The reason I'm even saying this is that he was speaking as though to a peer, NOT to a judge or executioner.

Oh, wait, HE WAS. Suddenly his words carry the weight of swords. Wielded against him. That's the problem here.

Words are not empty, and words have meaning. It is no different to say "kys" to a stranger in a video game than to say it to a stranger at a movie theater, or on the street, or at a sporting event, or whatever. The words mean the same.

You're free to believe permanently banning someone from a video game is "too harsh". It's no different from someone being removed from **any** venue for violating the rules of that venue (one of which is "common decency" in many cases). However, you seem to be... one sided. Everyone should have to put up with toxicity... but the toxic players shouldn't have to put up with everyone else expecting them to control their emotions. Where is the responsibility for one's self if it's always someone else's fault for being too "triggered" or "fragile"? If the toxic person doesn't have a responsibility to not be toxic, do the other players also not have a responsibility to "not be triggered"?

Not to mention you consider the words "kill yourself" to not mean that in some cases. If they don't mean that, what *do* they mean? In fact, this is one of the best examples of "it was just frustration" falling apart. Sure, everyone gets frustrated. You know what I do? Fuck. Shit. Damn. Motherfucker. Cocknuggets. Literally any other cursing. You know what isn't anywhere near my list of things to do? Tell another human being to take their own life. That's not frustration - that's **targeted**. It isn't just *directed at* someone, it is targeting them and saying they do not deserve to live. What?

There are simply so many flaws with the logic.

I'd like to point out rujitra's maturity, with respect. Some of us could learn from it. 

I remain firm that there should be more forgiveness for a slight such as this. Just as if a theater were to try to throw out a doctor taking a call in a theater whom took it out of the auditorium, I say it is too harsh. 

I will admit that I have always found symbols to be hallow, for the people that stand by them don't actually exemplify what the symbols mean. Similarly, I have had to live my life in the same regard to what people say. We're a bunch of liars and hypocrites with far too little exception. Our words have meaning, but our convictions and our words do not align. This is a personal issue because I have held honesty as one of my virtues, and am not blind to the lack of it everywhere I go.

Why, someone on these boards said that nobody likes my positivity, because it sounds fake. I was being honest! That's a perfect example, no matter how you look at it!

The point is that words don't have always have weight. In other words, the meaning of the words are... sometimes meaningless. Because they're a lie, an exaggeration, a frustration, a face, an attempt in vain to influence the world. This may sound like mere art, but no, I'm very literal and brutally honest here. "Kill yourself" did not mean "I wish for you to go find a way to end your life." It's REAL meaning was "I want you to stop being a disruption and it seems like you won't."

Stop thinking like a machine and accept that the actual meaning of our words might not be the 1+1 meaning. Few of us are as willing and/or able to articulate as well as you can. And I do mean *you*, whomever is reading this. Try to understand your fellow humans. Look at them, listen to them, touch them. Understand, and be forgiving.

I wish we could all be so kind, but this is a game... with a lot of killing and dying in it. So can we drop the expectation that we can't let this guy play again? Give a firm slap on the wrist, instead of exiling him. I know that won't happen, but that's what he deserves in a real human sense, not the ToSense.

Yes, I'm disagreeing with Riot's system. I play according to the rules not because I'm curbing my behavior, but because I'm not inclined to say things like that in the first place. Yet I believe we are a colorful bunch of people and killing one off, metaphorically speaking about the permaban, is not how they're going to trim the unsavory element.

I think, metaphorically speaking, a permaban is less like offing someone, and more like a criminal trespass from a retail location. OP can make a new account (disguise himself and sneak back into the store). OP is free to play other games (shop at other stores).

I'm neither a 'SJW' nor a 'RWNJ', or any of the other politically charged labels that people throw around. I'm just a regular dude. I view league as an 'investment' in my entertainment. Like a collection of VHS Movies. I'm not prone to negative behavior very often, but when I am I just keep it under control. This 'protects' my investment in my own entertainment.

Those VHS tapes that I invested in? I found new forms of entertainment. I threw them into cardboard boxes and into the garage. I no longer felt the need to protect that investment. I didn't care if they became dusty or water damaged. I eventually threw them away.

If people value the money they've invested into their entertainment, they should endeavor to protect said investment. For league, that means not violating the ToS. It's like an investment contract, where the return on investment is one's own personal entertainment.

If league no longer entertains you, do what you will with the account - it's analogous to tossing out those old video tapes.

---

On a final thought, OP spent $1500 on his account. Typing KYS got him banned. That's $500 per character... who ever knew typing could be so expensive?
